Pacman.Controller
Class GameController

java.lang.Object
  Pacman.Controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ControllerInterface
public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements ControllerInterface

The controller part of the model-view-controller-system. This class communicates with the model and the view to manage the game.

Field Summary
private  EditorTool activeTool
          When the map-editor is active, the controller needs to know the active tool to manipulate map-blocks
private  Game game
          The game (model) object
private  GUI gui
          The class to manage the main window
 
Constructor Summary

          Initialize model, view with objects that are provided; default value for activeTool

public void saveLevelAction()
This method is triggered when the user clicks the "Save Level" button in the main window. It then saves the level (Map)

startAction

public void startAction()
This method is triggered when the user clicks the "Start" button in the main window. It starts the game.

pauseAction

public void pauseAction()
This method is triggered when the user clicks the "Pause" button in the main window. It pauses the game.

Specified by:
pauseAction in interface ControllerInterface

stopAction

public void stopAction()
This method is triggered when the user clicks the "Stop" button in the main window. It stops (ends) the game and resets the board.

Specified by:
stopAction in interface ControllerInterface

toggleEditorAction

public void toggleEditorAction()
This method is triggered when the user clicks the "Editor" button in the main window. The the map-editor-mode is toggled on and off.

Specified by:
toggleEditorAction in interface ControllerInterface

setToolAction

public void setToolAction(EditorTool tool)
This method is triggered when the user clicks one of the tool buttons, while the map editor is active. The activeTool instance variable is set.

Specified by:
setToolAction in interface ControllerInterface

clickPanelAction

public void clickPanelAction(int[] relativePosition)
This method is triggered when the user clicks inside the graphicspanel. If editor-mode is active, the mapblocks are manipulated.

Specified by:
clickPanelAction in interface ControllerInterface

navigateAction

public void navigateAction(Direction direction)
Is called by GUI when user wants to change the Player's direction.

Specified by:
navigateAction in interface ControllerInterface
Parameters:
direction - The direction

getMessage

public java.lang.String getMessage()
This message will be displayed as text in the graphics panel. It is used for game-over messages and displaying the score at the end.

Specified by:
getMessage in interface ControllerInterface
